align=\"center\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n  \u003cb\u003eStylish CLI prompts that are user-friendly, intuitive and easy to create.\u003c/b\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\n  \u003csub\u003e\u0026gt;_ Prompts should be more like conversations than inquisitions▌\u003c/sub\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cbr\u003e\n\u003cp align=\"center\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n  \u003csub\u003e(Example shows Enquirer's \u003ca href=\"#survey-prompt\"\u003eSurvey Prompt\u003c/a\u003e)\u003c/sub\u003e\n  \u003ca target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer nofollow\" href=\"https://raw.githubusercontent.com/enquirer/enquirer/master/media/survey-prompt.gif\"\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://raw.githubusercontent.com/enquirer/enquirer/master/media/survey-prompt.gif\" alt=\"Enquirer Survey Prompt\" width=\"750\" data-animated-image=\"\" style=\"max-width: 100%;\"\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\n  \u003csub\u003eThe terminal in all examples is \u003ca href=\"https://hyper.is/\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003eHyper\u003c/a\u003e, theme is \u003ca href=\"https://github.com/jonschlinkert/hyper-monokai-extended\"\u003ehyper-monokai-extended\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/sub\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\n  \u003ca href=\"#built-in-prompts\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eSee more prompt examples\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cbr\u003e\n\u003cbr\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eCreated by \u003ca href=\"https://github.com/jonschlinkert\"\u003ejonschlinkert\u003c/a\u003e and \u003ca href=\"https://github.com/doowb\"\u003edoowb\u003c/a\u003e, Enquirer is fast, easy to use, and lightweight enough for small projects, while also being powerful and customizable enough for the most advanced use cases.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eFast\u003c/strong\u003e - \u003ca href=\"#-performance\"\u003eLoads in ~4ms\u003c/a\u003e (that's about \u003cem\u003e3-4 times faster than a \u003ca href=\"http://www.endmemo.com/sconvert/framespersecondframespermillisecond.php\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003esingle frame of a HD movie\u003c/a\u003e at 60fps\u003c/em\u003e)\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eLightweight\u003c/strong\u003e - Only one dependency, the excellent \u003ca href=\"https://github.com/doowb/ansi-colors\"\u003eansi-colors\u003c/a\u003e by \u003ca href=\"https://github.com/doowb\"\u003eBrian Woodward\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eEasy to implement\u003c/strong\u003e - Uses promises and async/await and sensible defaults to make prompts easy to create and implement.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eEasy to use\u003c/strong\u003e - Thrill your users with a better experience! Navigating around input and choices is a breeze. You can even create \u003ca href=\"/enquirer/enquirer/blob/master/examples/fun/countdown.js\"\u003equizzes\u003c/a\u003e, or \u003ca href=\"/enquirer/enquirer/blob/master/examples/fun/record.js\"\u003erecord\u003c/a\u003e and \u003ca href=\"/enquirer/enquirer/blob/master/examples/fun/play.js\"\u003eplayback\u003c/a\u003e key bindings to aid with tutorials and videos.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eIntuitive\u003c/strong\u003e - Keypress combos are available to simplify usage.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eFlexible\u003c/strong\u003e - All prompts can be used standalone or chained together.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eStylish\u003c/strong\u003e - Easily override semantic styles and symbols for any part of the prompt.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eExtensible\u003c/strong\u003e - Easily create and use \u003ca href=\"#-custom-prompts\"\u003ecustom prompts\u003c/a\u003e by extending Enquirer's built-in \u003ca href=\"#-prompts\"\u003eprompts\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003ePluggable\u003c/strong\u003e - Add advanced features to Enquirer using plugins.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eValidation\u003c/strong\u003e - Optionally validate user input with any prompt.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eWell tested\u003c/strong\u003e - All prompts are well-tested, and tests are easy to create without having to use brittle, hacky solutions to spy on prompts or \"inject\" values.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eExamples\u003c/strong\u003e - There are numerous \u003ca href=\"/enquirer/enquirer/blob/master/examples\"\u003eexamples\u003c/a\u003e available to help you get started.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eIf you like Enquirer, please consider starring or tweeting about this project to show your support. uses this value to determine the type of prompt to run, but it's optional when prompts are run directly.\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003e\u003ccode\u003ename\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003eyes\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003e\u003ccode\u003estring|function\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003eUsed as the key for the answer on the returned values (answers) object.\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003e\u003ccode\u003emessage\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003eyes\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003e\u003ccode\u003estring|function\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003eThe message to display when the prompt is rendered in the \u003ccode\u003etrue\u003c/code\u003e it will not ask that prompt.\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003e\u003ccode\u003einitial\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003eno\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003e\u003ccode\u003estring|function\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003eThe default value to return if the user does not supply a value.\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003e\u003ccode\u003eformat\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003eno\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003e\u003ccode\u003efunction\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003eFunction to format user input in the terminal.\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003e\u003ccode\u003eresult\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003eno\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003e\u003ccode\u003efunction\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003eFunction to format the final submitted value before it's returned.\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003e\u003ccode\u003evalidate\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003eno\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003e\u003ccode\u003efunction\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003eFunction to validate the submitted value before it's returned. This function may return a boolean or a string. If a string is returned it will be used as the validation error message.\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/tbody\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eExample the currently selected choice in the visible list of choices. This is similar to the concept of focus in HTML and CSS. Focused choices are always visible (on-screen). When a list of choices is longer than the list of visible choices, and an off-screen choice is \u003cem\u003efocused\u003c/em\u003e, the list will scroll to the focused choice and re-render.\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003e\u003ccode\u003efocused\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003eGets the currently selected choice. objects.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable\u003e\n\u003cthead\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003cth\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eOption\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/th\u003e\n\u003cth\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eType\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/th\u003e\n\u003cth\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eDescription\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/th\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/thead\u003e\n\u003ctbody\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003e\u003ccode\u003ename\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003e\u003ccode\u003estring\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003eThe unique key to identify a choice\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003e\u003ccode\u003emessage\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003e\u003ccode\u003estring\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003eThe message to display in the terminal. \u003ccode\u003ename\u003c/code\u003e is used when this is undefined.\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003e\u003ccode\u003evalue\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003e\u003ccode\u003estring\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003eValue to associate with the choice. Useful for creating key-value pairs from user choices. \u003ccode\u003ename\u003c/code\u003e is used when this is undefined.\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003e\u003ccode\u003echoices\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003e\u003ccode\u003earray\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003eArray of \"child\" choices.\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003e\u003ccode\u003ehint\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003e\u003ccode\u003estring\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003eHelp message to display next to a choice.\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003e\u003ccode\u003erole\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003e\u003ccode\u003estring\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003eDetermines how the choice will be displayed. Currently the only role supported is \u003ccode\u003eseparator\u003c/code\u003e. Additional roles may be added in the future (like \u003ccode\u003eheading\u003c/code\u003e, etc). Please create a [feature request]\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003e\u003ccode\u003eenabled\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003e\u003ccode\u003eboolean\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003eEnabled a choice by default. This is only supported when \u003ccode\u003eoptions.multiple\u003c/code\u003e is true or on prompts that support multiple choices, like \u003ca href=\"#-multiselect\"\u003eMultiSelect\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003e\u003ccode\u003edisabled\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003e\u003ccode\u003eboolean|string\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003eDisable a choice so that it cannot be selected. This value may either be \u003ccode\u003etrue\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003efalse\u003c/code\u003e, or a message to display.\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003e\u003ccode\u003eindicator\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003e\u003ccode\u003estring|function\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003ctd\u003eCustom indicator to render for a choice (like a check or radio button).\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/tbody\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003eThe \u003ccode\u003eAuthPrompt\u003c/code\u003e is used to create prompts to log in user using any authentication method. For example, Enquirer uses this class as the basis for the \u003ca href=\"#basicauth-prompt\"\u003eBasicAuth Prompt\u003c/a\u003e. You can also find prompt examples in \u003ccode\u003eexamples/auth/\u003c/code\u003e folder that utilizes \u003ccode\u003eAuthPrompt\u003c/code\u003e to create OAuth based authentication prompt or a prompt that authenticates using time-based OTP, among others.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003eAuthPrompt\u003c/code\u003e has a factory function that creates an instance of \u003ccode\u003eAuthPrompt\u003c/code\u003e class and it expects an \u003ccode\u003eauthenticate\u003c/code\u003e function, as an argument, which overrides the \u003ccode\u003eauthenticate\u003c/code\u003e function of the \u003ccode\u003eAuthPrompt\u003c/code\u003e class.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ch4 class=\"highlight highlight-source-js notranslate position-relative overflow-auto\" dir=\"auto\" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=\"const { AuthPrompt } = require('enquirer');\n\nfunction authenticate(value, state) {\n  if (value.username === this.options.username \u0026amp;\u0026amp; value.password === this.options.password) {\n    return true;\n  }\n  return false;\n}\n\nconst CustomAuthPrompt = AuthPrompt.create(authenticate);\n\nconst prompt = new CustomAuthPrompt({\n  name: 'password',\n  message: 'Please enter your password',\n  username: 'rajat-sr',\n  password: '1234567',\n  choices: [\n    { name: 'username', message: 'username' },\n    { name: 'password', message: 'password' }\n  ]\n});\n\nprompt\n  .run()\n  .then(answer =\u0026gt; console.log('Authenticated?', answer))\n  .catch(console.error);\"\u003e\u003cpre\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-k\"\u003econst\u003c/span\u003e \u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e{\u003c/span\u003e class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e;\u003c/span\u003e\n\n\u003cspan class=\"pl-k\"\u003efunction\u003c/span\u003e \u003cspan class=\"pl-en\"\u003eauthenticate\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan extends Prompt {\n  constructor(options = {}) {\n    super(options);\n    this.value = options.initial || 0;\n    this.cursorHide();\n  }\n  up() {\n    this.value++;\n    this.render();\n  }\n  down() {\n    this.value--;\n    this.render();\n  }\n  render() {\n    this.clear(); // clear previously rendered prompt from the terminal\n    this.write(`${this.state.message}: ${this.value}`);\n  }\n}\n\n// Use the prompt by creating an instance of your custom prompt class.\nconst prompt = new HaiKarate({\n  message: 'How many sprays do you want?',\n  initial: 10\n});\n\nprompt.run()\n alt="downloads" data-canonical-src="https://img.shields.io/npm/dm/enquirer.svg" style="max-width: 100%;">  </a></p><br><br><p align="center" dir="auto">  <b>Stylish CLI prompts that are user-friendly, intuitive and easy to create.</b><br>  <sub>>_ Prompts should be more like conversations than inquisitions▌</sub></p><br><p align="center" dir="auto">  <sub>(Example shows Enquirer's <a href="#survey-prompt">Survey Prompt</a>)</sub>  <a target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer nofollow" href="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/enquirer/enquirer/master/media/survey-prompt.gif"><img src="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/enquirer/enquirer/master/media/survey-prompt.gif" alt="Enquirer Survey Prompt" width="750" data-animated-image="" style="max-width: 100%;"></a><br>  <sub>The terminal in all examples is <a href="https://hyper.is/" rel="nofollow">Hyper</a>, theme is <a href="https://github.com/jonschlinkert/hyper-monokai-extended">hyper-monokai-extended</a>.</sub><br><br>  <a href="#built-in-prompts"><strong>See more prompt examples</strong></a></p><br><br><p dir="auto">Created by <a href="https://github.com/jonschlinkert">jonschlinkert</a> and <a href="https://github.com/doowb">doowb</a>, Enquirer is fast, easy to use, and lightweight enough for small projects, while also being powerful and customizable enough for the most advanced use cases.</p><ul dir="auto"><li><strong>Fast</strong> - <a href="#-performance">Loads in ~4ms</a> (that's about <em>3-4 times faster than a <a href="http://www.endmemo.com/sconvert/framespersecondframespermillisecond.php" rel="nofollow">single frame of a HD movie</a> at 60fps</em>)</li><li><strong>Lightweight</strong> - Only one dependency, the excellent <a href="https://github.com/doowb/ansi-colors">ansi-colors</a> by <a href="https://github.com/doowb">Brian Woodward</a>.</li><li><strong>Easy to implement</strong> - Uses promises and async/await and sensible defaults to make prompts easy to create and implement.</li><li><strong>Easy to use</strong> - Thrill your users with a better experience! Navigating around input and choices is a breeze. You can even create <a href="/enquirer/enquirer/blob/master/examples/fun/countdown.js">quizzes</a>, or <a href="/enquirer/enquirer/blob/master/examples/fun/record.js">record</a> and <a href="/enquirer/enquirer/blob/master/examples/fun/play.js">playback</a> key bindings to aid with tutorials and videos.</li><li><strong>Intuitive</strong> - Keypress combos are available to simplify usage.</li><li><strong>Flexible</strong> - All prompts can be used standalone or chained together.</li><li><strong>Stylish</strong> - Easily override semantic styles and symbols for any part of the prompt.</li><li><strong>Extensible</strong> - Easily create and use <a href="#-custom-prompts">custom prompts</a> by extending Enquirer's built-in <a href="#-prompts">prompts</a>.</li><li><strong>Pluggable</strong> - Add advanced features to Enquirer using plugins.</li><li><strong>Validation</strong> - Optionally validate user input with any prompt.</li><li><strong>Well tested</strong> - All prompts are well-tested, and tests are easy to create without having to use brittle, hacky solutions to spy on prompts or "inject" values.</li><li><strong>Examples</strong> - There are numerous <a href="/enquirer/enquirer/blob/master/examples">examples</a> available to help you get started.</li></ul><p dir="auto">If you like Enquirer, please consider starring or tweeting about this project to show your support. Thanks!</p><br><p align="center" dir="auto">  <b>>_ Ready to start making prompts your users will love? ▌</b><br>  <a target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer nofollow" with special features and functionality for rendering the types of values you want to show users in the terminal, and subsequently returning the types of values you need to use in your application.</p><p dir="auto"><strong>How can I customize prompts?</strong></p><p dir="auto">Below in this guide you will find information about creating <a href="#-custom-prompts">custom prompts</a>. For now, we'll focus on how to customize an existing prompt.</p><p dir="auto">All of the individual <a href="#built-in-prompts">prompt classes</a> in this library are exposed as static properties on Enquirer. This allows them to be used directly without using <code>enquirer.prompt()</code>.</p><p dir="auto">Use this approach if you need to modify a prompt instance, or listen for events on the prompt.</p><p object.</td></tr><tr><td><code>message</code></td><td>yes</td><td><code>string|function</code></td><td>The message to display when the prompt is rendered in the terminal.</td></tr><tr><td><code>skip</code></td><td>no</td><td><code>boolean|function</code></td><td>If <code>true</code> it will not ask that 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">There are 5 (soon to be 6!) type classes:</p><ul dir="auto"><li><a href="#arrayprompt">ArrayPrompt</a><ul dir="auto"><li><a href="#options">Options</a></li><li><a href="#properties">Properties</a></li><li><a href="#methods">Methods</a></li><li><a href="#choices">Choices</a></li><li><a href="#defining-choices">Defining choices</a></li><li><a href="#choice-properties">Choice properties</a></li><li><a href="#related-prompts">Related prompts</a></li></ul></li><li><a href="#authprompt">AuthPrompt</a></li><li><a type is a low-level class that may be used as a starting point for creating higher level prompts. Continue reading to learn how.</p><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">ArrayPrompt</h3><a id="user-content-arrayprompt" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: ArrayPrompt" href="#arrayprompt"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">The <code>ArrayPrompt</code> class is used for creating prompts that display a list of choices in the terminal. For example, Enquirer uses this class as the basis for the <a href="#select">Select</a> and <a href="#survey">Survey</a> prompts.</p><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h4 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Options</h4><a id="user-content-options" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: Options" href="#options"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">In addition to the <a href="#options">options</a> available to all prompts, Array prompts also support the following options.</p><table><thead><tr><th><strong>Option</strong></th><th><strong>Required?</strong></th><th><strong>Type</strong></th><th><strong>Description</strong></th></tr></thead><tbody><tr><td><code>autofocus</code></td><td><code>no</code></td><td><code>string|number</code></td><td>The index or name of the choice that should have focus when the prompt loads. Only one choice may have focus at a time.</td></tr><tr><td><code>stdin</code></td><td><code>no</code></td><td><code>stream</code></td><td>The input stream to use for emitting keypress events. Defaults to <code>process.stdin</code>.</td></tr><tr><td><code>stdout</code></td><td><code>no</code></td><td><code>stream</code></td><td>The output stream to use for writing the prompt to the terminal. Defaults to <code>process.stdout</code>.</td></tr><tr><td></td><td></td><td></td><td></td></tr></tbody></table><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h4 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Properties</h4><a id="user-content-properties" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: Properties" href="#properties"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">Array prompts have the following instance properties and getters.</p><table><thead><tr><th><strong>Property name</strong></th><th><strong>Type</strong></th><th><strong>Description</strong></th></tr></thead><tbody><tr><td><code>choices</code></td><td><code>array</code></td><td>Array of choices that have been normalized from choices passed on the prompt options.</td></tr><tr><td><code>cursor</code></td><td><code>number</code></td><td>Position of the cursor relative to the <em>user input (string)</em>.</td></tr><tr><td><code>enabled</code></td><td><code>array</code></td><td>Returns an array of enabled choices.</td></tr><tr><td><code>focused</code></td><td><code>array</code></td><td>Returns the currently selected choice in the visible list of choices. This is similar to the concept of focus in HTML and CSS. Focused choices are always visible (on-screen). When a list of choices is longer than the list of visible choices, and an off-screen choice is <em>focused</em>, the list will scroll to the focused choice and re-render.</td></tr><tr><td><code>focused</code></td><td>Gets the currently selected choice. Equivalent to <code>prompt.choices[prompt.index]</code>.</td><td></td></tr><tr><td><code>index</code></td><td><code>number</code></td><td>Position of the pointer in the <em>visible list (array) of choices</em>.</td></tr><tr><td><code>limit</code></td><td><code>number</code></td><td>The number of choices to display on-screen.</td></tr><tr><td><code>selected</code></td><td><code>array</code></td><td>Either a list of enabled choices (when <code>options.multiple</code> is true) or the currently focused choice.</td></tr><tr><td><code>visible</code></td><td><code>string</code></td><td></td></tr></tbody></table><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h4 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Methods</h4><a id="user-content-methods" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: Methods" href="#methods"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><table><thead><tr><th><strong>Method</strong></th><th><strong>Description</strong></th></tr></thead><tbody><tr><td><code>pointer()</code></td><td>Returns the visual symbol to use to identify the choice that currently has focus. The <code>❯</code> symbol is often used for this. The pointer is not always visible, as with the <code>autocomplete</code> prompt.</td></tr><tr><td><code>indicator()</code></td><td>Returns the visual symbol that indicates whether or not a choice is checked/enabled.</td></tr><tr><td><code>focus()</code></td><td>Sets focus on a choice, if it can be focused.</td></tr></tbody></table><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h4 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Choices</h4><a id="user-content-choices" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: Choices" href="#choices"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">Array prompts support the <code>choices</code> option, which is the array of choices users will be able to select from when rendered in the terminal.</p><p dir="auto"><strong>Type</strong>: <code>string|object</code></p><p dir="auto"><strong>Example</strong></p><div class="highlight highlight-source-js notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="{  name: string;  message: string | undefined;  value: string | undefined;  hint: string | undefined;  disabled: boolean | string | undefined;}"><pre><span class="pl-kos">{</span>  name: <span class="pl-s1">string</span><span class="pl-kos">;</span>  message: <span class="pl-s1">string</span> <span class="pl-c1">undefined</span><span class="pl-kos">;</span>  hint: <span class="pl-s1">string</span> <span class="pl-c1">|</span> <span class="pl-c1">undefined</span><span class="pl-kos">;</span> objects.</p><table><thead><tr><th><strong>Option</strong></th><th><strong>Type</strong></th><th><strong>Description</strong></th></tr></thead><tbody><tr><td><code>name</code></td><td><code>string</code></td><td>The unique key to identify a choice</td></tr><tr><td><code>message</code></td><td><code>string</code></td><td>The message to display in the terminal. <code>name</code> is used when this is undefined.</td></tr><tr><td><code>value</code></td><td><code>string</code></td><td>Value to associate with the choice. Useful for creating key-value pairs from user choices. <code>name</code> is used when this is undefined.</td></tr><tr><td><code>choices</code></td><td><code>array</code></td><td>Array of "child" choices.</td></tr><tr><td><code>hint</code></td><td><code>string</code></td><td>Help message to display next to a choice.</td></tr><tr><td><code>role</code></td><td><code>string</code></td><td>Determines how the choice will be displayed. Currently the only role supported is <code>separator</code>. Additional roles may be added in the future (like <code>heading</code>, etc). Please create a [feature request]</td></tr><tr><td><code>enabled</code></td><td><code>boolean</code></td><td>Enabled a choice by default. This is only supported when <code>options.multiple</code> is true or on prompts that support multiple choices, like <a href="#-multiselect">MultiSelect</a>.</td></tr><tr><td><code>disabled</code></td><td><code>boolean|string</code></td><td>Disable a choice so that it cannot be selected. This value may either be <code>true</code>, <code>false</code>, or a message to display.</td></tr><tr><td><code>indicator</code></td><td><code>string|function</code></td><td>Custom indicator to render for a choice (like a check or radio button).</td></tr></tbody></table><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h4 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Related prompts</h4><a For example, Enquirer uses this class as the basis for the <a href="#basicauth-prompt">BasicAuth Prompt</a>. You can also find prompt examples in <code>examples/auth/</code> folder that utilizes <code>AuthPrompt</code> to create OAuth based authentication prompt or a prompt that authenticates using time-based OTP, among others.</p><p dir="auto"><code>AuthPrompt</code> has a factory function that creates an instance of <code>AuthPrompt</code> class and it expects an <code>authenticate</code> function, as an argument, which overrides the <code>authenticate</code> function of the <code>AuthPrompt</code> class.</p><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h4 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Methods</h4><a id="user-content-methods-1" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: Methods" href="#methods-1"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><table><thead><tr><th><strong>Method</strong></th><th><strong>Description</strong></th></tr></thead><tbody><tr><td><code>authenticate()</code></td><td>Contain all the authentication logic. This function should be overridden to implement custom authentication logic. The default <code>authenticate</code> function throws an error if no other function is provided.</td></tr></tbody></table><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h4 tabindex="-1"
